member.name: M:HASS.Agent.Shared.Functions.NativeMethod.OpenProcessToken(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,HASS.Agent.Shared.Functions.SafeTokenHandle@)
member.summary: The function opens the access token associated with a process.
member.param: A handle to the process whose access token is opened.
Specifies an access mask that specifies the requested types of access to the access token.
Outputs a handle that identifies the newly opened access token when the function returns.

member.name: M:HASS.Agent.Shared.Functions.NativeMethod.DuplicateTokenEx(HASS.Agent.Shared.Functions.SafeTokenHandle,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,HASS.Agent.Shared.Functions.SECURITY_IMPERSONATION_LEVEL,HASS.Agent.Shared.Functions.TOKEN_TYPE,HASS.Agent.Shared.Functions.SafeTokenHandle@)
member.summary: The DuplicateTokenEx function creates a new access token that duplicates an existing token. This function can create either a primary token or an impersonation token.
member.param: A handle to an access token opened with TOKEN_DUPLICATE access.
Specifies the requested access rights for the new token.

A pointer to a SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that specifies a security descriptor for the new token and determines whether child processes can inherit the token. If lpTokenAttributes is NULL, the token gets a default security descriptor and the handle cannot be inherited.
Specifies the impersonation level of the new token.
TokenPrimary - The new token is a primary token that you can use in the CreateProcessAsUser function. TokenImpersonation - The new token is an impersonation token.
Receives the new token.

member.name: M:HASS.Agent.Shared.Functions.NativeMethod.GetTokenInformation(HASS.Agent.Shared.Functions.SafeTokenHandle,HASS.Agent.Shared.Functions.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The function retrieves a specified type of information about an access token. The calling process must have appropriate access rights to obtain the information.
member.param: A handle to an access token from which information is retrieved.
Specifies a value from the TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS enumerated type to identify the type of information the function retrieves.
A pointer to a buffer the function fills with the requested information.
Specifies the size, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by the TokenInformation parameter.
A pointer to a variable that receives the number of bytes needed for the buffer pointed to by the TokenInformation parameter.

member.name: M:HASS.Agent.Shared.Functions.NativeMethod.SetTokenInformation(HASS.Agent.Shared.Functions.SafeTokenHandle,HASS.Agent.Shared.Functions.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The function sets various types of information for a specified access token. The information that this function sets replaces existing information. The calling process must have appropriate access rights to set the information.
member.param: A handle to the access token for which information is to be set.
A value from the TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS enumerated type that identifies the type of information the function sets.
A pointer to a buffer that contains the information set in the access token.
Specifies the length, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by TokenInformation.

member.name: M:HASS.Agent.Shared.Functions.NativeMethod.GetSidSubAuthority(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: The function returns a pointer to a specified subauthority in a security identifier (SID). The subauthority value is a relative identifier (RID).
member.param: A pointer to the SID structure from which a pointer to a subauthority is to be returned.
Specifies an index value identifying the subauthority array element whose address the function will return.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a pointer to the specified SID subauthority. To get extended error information, call GetLastError. If the function fails, the return value is undefined. The function fails if the specified SID structure is not valid or if the index value specified by the nSubAuthority parameter is out of bounds.

Subauthority value to place in the SID.

Subauthority value to place in the SID.

member.name: M:HASS.Agent.Shared.Functions.NativeMethod.FreeSid(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The FreeSid function frees a security identifier (SID) previously allocated by using the AllocateAndInitializeSid function.
member.param: A pointer to the SID structure to free.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the function returns NULL. If the function fails, it returns a pointer to the SID structure represented by the pSid parameter.

member.name: M:HASS.Agent.Shared.Functions.NativeMethod.GetLengthSid(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The function returns the length, in bytes, of a valid security identifier (SID).
member.param: A pointer to the SID structure whose length is returned.
member.returns: If the SID structure is valid, the return value is the length, in bytes, of the SID structure.

member.summary: Creates a new process and its primary thread. The new process runs in the security context of the user represented by the specified token.
member.param: A handle to the primary token that represents a user.
The name of the module to be executed.
The command line to be executed. The maximum length of this string is 32K characters.
A pointer to a SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that specifies a security descriptor for the new process object and determines whether child processes can inherit the returned handle to the process.
A pointer to a SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that specifies a security descriptor for the new thread object and determines whether child processes can inherit the returned handle to the thread.
If this parameter is true, each inheritable handle in the calling process is inherited by the new process. If the parameter is false, the handles are not inherited.
The flags that control the priority class and the creation of the process.
A pointer to an environment block for the new process.
The full path to the current directory for the process.
References a STARTUPINFO structure.
Outputs a PROCESS_INFORMATION structure that receives identification information about the new process.

member.name: M:HASS.Agent.Shared.Functions.KnownFolder.SHGetKnownFolderPath(System.Guid,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Retrieves the full path of a known folder identified by the folder's KNOWNFOLDERID.
member.param: A reference to the KNOWNFOLDERID that identifies the folder.
Flags that specify special retrieval options.
An access token that represents a particular user. If this parameter is NULL, which is the most common usage, the function requests the known folder for the current user.

When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to a null-terminated Unicode string that specifies the path of the known folder. The calling process is responsible for freeing this resource once it is no longer needed by calling CoTaskMemFree.

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.CommandsManager_CommandsManager_SendWindowToFrontCommandDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Looks for the specified process, and tries to send its main window to the front.
If the application is minimized, it'll get restored.
Example: if you want to send VLC to the foreground, use 'vlc'..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.CommandsManager_CustomCommandDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Execute a custom command.
These commands run without special elevation. To run elevated, create a Scheduled Task, and use 'schtasks /Run /TN "TaskName"' as the command to execute your task.
Or enable 'run as low integrity' for even stricter execution..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.CommandsManager_CustomExecutorCommandDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Executes the command through the configured custom executor (in Configuration -> External Tools).
Your command is provided as an argument 'as is', so you have to supply your own quotes etc. if necessary..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.CommandsManager_HibernateCommandDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Sets the machine in hibernation..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.CommandsManager_KeyCommandDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Simulates a single keypress.
You can pick any of these values: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/inputdev/virtual-key-codes
If you need more keys and/or modifiers like CTRL, use the MultipleKeys command..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.CommandsManager_LaunchUrlCommandDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Launches the provided URL, by default in your default browser.
To use 'incognito', provide a specific browser in Configuration -> External Tools.
If you just want a window with a specific URL (not an entire browser), use a 'WebView' command..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.CommandsManager_MultipleKeysCommandDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Simulates pressing mulitple keys.
You need to put [ ] between every key, otherwise HASS.Agent can't tell them apart. So say you want to press X TAB Y SHIFT-Z, it'd be [X] [{TAB}] [Y] [+Z].
There are a few tricks you can use:
- If you want a bracket pressed, escape it, so [ is [\[] and ] is [\]]
- Special keys go between { }, like {TAB} or {UP}
- Put a + in front of a key to add SHIFT, ^ for CTRL and % for ALT. So, +C is SHIFT-C. Or, +(CD) is SHIFT-C and SHIFT-D, while +CD is SHIFT-C and D
[rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.CommandsManager_PowershellCommandDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Execute a Powershell command or script.
You can either provide the location of a script (*.ps1), or a single-line command.
This will run without special elevation..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.CommandsManager_PublishAllSensorsCommandDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Resets all sensor checks, forcing all sensors to process and send their value.
Useful for example if you want to force HASS.Agent to update all your sensors after a HA reboot..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.CommandsManager_RestartCommandDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Restarts the machine after one minute.
Tip: accidentally triggered? Run 'shutdown /a' to abort..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.CommandsManager_ShutdownCommandDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Shuts down the machine after one minute.
Tip: accidentally triggered? Run 'shutdown /a' to abort..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.CommandsManager_SleepCommandDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Puts the machine to sleep.
Note: due to a limitation in Windows, this only works if hibernation is disabled, otherwise it will just hibernate.
You can use something like NirCmd (http://www.nirsoft.net/utils/nircmd.html) to circumvent this..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.CommandsManager_WebViewCommandDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Shows a window with the provided URL.
This differs from the 'LaunchUrl' command in that it doesn't load a full-fledged browser, just the provided URL in its own window.
You can use this to for instance quickly show Home Assistant's dashboard.
By default, it stores cookies indefinitely so you only have to log in once..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.Configuration_ProcessChanges_MessageBox1
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to You've changed your device's name.
All your sensors and commands will now be unpublished, and HASS.Agent will restart afterwards to republish them.
Don't worry, they'll keep their current names, so your automations or scripts will keep working.
Note: the name will get 'sanitized', which means everything except letters, digits and whitespace get replaced by an underscore. This is required by HA..

member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to If you want, HASS.Agent can check for updates in the background.
You'll get a notification (once per update) , letting you know a new version is ready to be installed.
Do you want to enable this functionality ? .

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.OnboardingUpdates_LblInfo2
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to When there's an update, HASS.Agent will offer the option to open the release page. But if you want, HASS.Agent can also download and launch the installer for you - even less to do !
The certificate of the downloaded file will get checked. And you'll still see a page with the release notes, ánd you still need to manually approve - nothing is done without your consent..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_AudioSensorsDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Provides information various aspects of your device's audio:
Current peak volume level (can be used as a simple 'is something playing' value).
Default audiodevice: name, state and volume.
Summary of your audio sessions: application name, muted state, volume and current peak volume..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Provides a sensor with the current charging status, estimated amount of minutes on a full charge, remaining charge in percentage, remaining charge in minutes and the powerline status..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_DisplaySensorsDescription

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Dummy sensor for testing purposes, sends a random integer value between 0 and 100..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_GpuTemperatureSensorDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Provides the current temperature of the first GPU..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_LastActiveSensorDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Provides a datetime value containing the last moment the user provided any input..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_LastBootSensorDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Provides a datetime value containing the last moment the system (re)booted.
Important: Windows' FastBoot option can throw this value off, because that's a form of hibernation. You can disable it through Power Options -> 'Choose what the power buttons do' -> uncheck 'Turn on fast start-up'. It doesn't make much difference for modern machines with SSDs, but disabling makes sure you get a clean state after rebooting..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_LastSystemStateChangeSensorDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Provides the last system state change:
HassAgentStarted, Logoff, SystemShutdown, Resume, Suspend, ConsoleConnect, ConsoleDisconnect, RemoteConnect, RemoteDisconnect, SessionLock, SessionLogoff, SessionLogon, SessionRemoteControl and SessionUnlock..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_LoggedUserSensorDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns the name of the currently logged user..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_LoggedUsersSensorDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns a json-formatted list of currently logged users..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_MemoryUsageSensorDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Provides the amount of used memory as a percentage..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_MicrophoneActiveSensorDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Provides a bool value based on whether the microphone is currently being used..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_NamedWindowSensorDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Provides an ON/OFF value based on whether the window is currently open (doesn't have to be active)..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_NetworkSensorsDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Provides card info, configuration, transfer- & package statistics and addresses (ip, mac, dhcp, dns) of the selected network card(s).
This is a multi-value sensor..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_PerformanceCounterSensorDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Provides the values of a performance counter.
For example, the built-in CPU load sensor uses these values:
Category: Processor Counter: % Processor Time Instance: _Total
You can explore the counters through Windows' 'perfmon.exe' tool..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_ProcessActiveSensorDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Provides the number of active instances of the process..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_ServiceStateSensorDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Returns the state of the provided service: NotFound, Stopped, StartPending, StopPending, Running, ContinuePending, PausePending or Paused.
Make sure to provide the 'Service name', not the 'Display name'..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_SessionStateSensorDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Provides the current session state:
Locked, Unlocked or Unknown.
Use a LastSystemStateChangeSensor to monitor session state changes..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_StorageSensorsDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Provides the labels, total size (MB), available space (MB), used space (MB) and file system of all present non-removable disks..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_UserNotificationStateSensorDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Provides the current user state:
NotPresent, Busy, RunningDirect3dFullScreen, PresentationMode, AcceptsNotifications, QuietTime or RunningWindowsStoreApp.
Can for instance be used to determine whether to send notifications or TTS messages..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_WebcamActiveSensorDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Provides a bool value based on whether the webcam is currently being used..

member.name: P:HASS.Agent.Shared.Resources.Localization.Languages.SensorsManager_WindowsUpdatesSensorsDescription
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Provides a sensor with the amount of pending driver updates and a sensor with the amount of pending software updates.
This is a costly request, so the recommended interval is 15 minutes (900 seconds). But it's capped at 10 minutes, if you provide a lower value, you'll get the last known list..
